image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police say they have found what is believed to be human remains in the search for missing Queensland teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: Breaking: Police say remains found in search for Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Six family members walk down steps outside court

props.synopsis: The families of children killed in the Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy of 2021 have reacted with dismay and anger after the charge of failing to comply with health and safety requirements was found to be unproven against the castle's operator.

title.children: Families 'broken' after not guilty verdict in Hillcrest jumping castle case

image.altText: a man walking as a man with a camera follows him

props.synopsis: The former Sydney teacher has lost his appeal against a conviction for unlawful sexual activity with a student in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson loses appeal over unlawful sexual activity with student conviction

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson didn't tell a "single person" that she may have accidentally added foraged mushrooms to a lunch that eventually killed three of her relatives, her murder trial has heard.

title.children: Erin Patterson asked why she didn't raise alarm about foraged mushrooms

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: The toppling of Tasmania's premier has drawn strong reactions from across Australia. Some are calling it a "fiasco" while others say the turmoil has turned the state into the nation's "laughing stock".

title.children: Australia reacts to Tasmanian political 'clown show'

image.altText: Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell pose for a photograph in a party

props.synopsis: The bromance between President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk blown up with an unsubstantiated accusation about the Epstein files. Here's what to know.

title.children: Elon Musk says Donald Trump is in the Epstein files — here's the background

image.altText: Manele in chair

props.synopsis: The Solomon Islands government blocked a group of Taiwanese officials from entering the Pacific country earlier this year, stirring fresh concerns in Taipei that it might be locked out of a key regional meeting in Honiara later this year.

title.children: Solomon Islands bars Taiwan delegation, sparks alarm ahead of Pacific Islands Forum

image.altText: A man sits at a table in a restaurant smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The UN says there is evidence the Australian engineer was tortured as he spent more than four years in an Iraqi jail.

title.children: Australian Robert Pether released from Iraqi prison

image.altText: Two men in a screenshot from CCTV hold jerry cans outside a building

props.synopsis: Officers from the Joint Counter-Terrorism Taskforce raided at least three homes in Melbourne's north today in relation to a fire at the Adass Israel synagogue in December last year.

title.children: Homes raided by terror taskforce investigating Adass Israel synagogue fire

image.altText: Adelaide captain Jordan Dawson looks downfield as he runs with the ball as Lions and Crows players watch behind him.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Crows face a big test of the potential for their 2025 season, as they take on the defending premiers Brisbane Lions in a Friday night blockbuster at Adelaide Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Crows test flag credentials against Lions at Adelaide Oval

image.altText: Scott Drinkwater watches the ball after dropping it over the line.

props.synopsis: North Queensland fullback Scott Drinkwater drops a bomb in the final minute of the first half to hand the Melbourne Storm a late try. Follow live.

title.children: Scott Drinkwater's blunders gift sloppy Storm crucial tries

image.altText: A selfie of Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya with a view of Hobart below them

props.synopsis: The two Queenslanders were due to leave Tasmania on Wednesday, but didn't board their flight home to Brisbane.

title.children: Two Queensland tourists thought to be missing in Tasmania

image.altText: Fire and smoke rise in the city after drone strike in Kyiv

props.synopsis: Russia has mounted an intense and sustained barrage on the Ukrainian capital following Kyiv's most audacious attack on its neighbour since the war began.

title.children: Four killed and 20 injured in Russia's overnight attack on Kyiv

image.altText: A woman with blonde, frizzy hair wears spectacles and smiles as she takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: High school teacher Karly Rae, 36, has been released from custody after telling a NSW court she stands a high risk of developing complications during her pregnancy.

title.children: Teacher accused of sex with boy, 15, granted bail due to pregnancy

image.altText: Two flame towers from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant, overlooking the signature red rocks of the Pilbara.

props.synopsis: One of the lead scientists behind a project monitoring rock art along the Burrup Peninsula in Western Australia has broken his silence.

title.children: Scientist rejects 'gag' accusation over Murujuga rock art report

image.altText: A picture of smiling Chloe Hayden's face alongside a palomino horse's face.

props.synopsis: The Heartbreak High actor and disability advocate shares how she is learning to rest and make room for what she loves beyond work.

title.children: 'I love being in the bush': Chloé Hayden on finding balance in a busy life

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open in a parliament ripping a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's parliament hands record suspensions to three Indigenous Māori MPs after they performed a haka to protest a controversial bill last year.

title.children: Māori Party MPs receive record suspensions over haka protest

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered in a city CBD.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people in Alice Springs and Melbourne have gathered at vigils to mourn Kumanjayi White and demand "justice", 10 days on from the young Warlpiri man's death in police custody.

title.children: Kumanjayi White's family demands 'justice' at Alice Springs, Melbourne vigils

image.altText: A man in a formal suit stands in front of a PNG flag.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's peak anti-corruption body is on the brink of implosion, senior staff say, as its Australian and New Zealand bosses accuse each other of criminal activity.

title.children: PNG police issue arrest warrant for Australian anti-corruption boss

image.altText: Two people stand outside a court building with banners in the background

props.synopsis: Three climate activists who planned to release stench gas in an attempt to cause the evacuation of a Woodside annual general meeting in Perth's CBD have been fined $10,000 each.

title.children: Climate activists fined $10k each after Woodside stench gas media stunt

image.altText: The interior of a large industrial plant

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has set aside another $384 million to keep the Whyalla steelworks running next financial year — doubling the amount already allocated to keep the plant operating during administration.

title.children: $384m contingency to keep Whyalla steelworks afloat

image.altText: Film critics David Stratton and Margaret Pomeranz toast to their star on the Australian Film Walk of Fame.

props.synopsis: Plus remembering queer literature icon Edmund White and Baby Reindeer's creator is headed to Australia for a TV industry summit.

title.children: Aussie Walk of Fame honours beloved film critics David and Margaret

image.altText: Jai Opetaia stands in boxing stance

props.synopsis: He's an unbackable favourite to defend his IBF and The Ring cruiserweight world title straps but Aussie boxing star Jai Opetaia respects Italian Claudio Squeo.

title.children: Opetaia, Huni set for a Sunday special on opposite sides of the world

image.altText: A man in a black hoodie opens the door of a white car

props.synopsis: In 2023, a shot fired by Kamal El Jamal went through the garage ceiling, the floorboards of the above bedroom and through the mattress before hitting his partner who was laying on the bed.

title.children: Woman will never walk again after partner shot her through garage ceiling

image.altText: A woman seeking at a press stand-up.

props.synopsis: Cairns Mayor Amy Eden is under fire for saying she had conducted online checks on retirement village residents opposed to a controversial change that will see huge council rate hikes.

title.children: Retirement village residents facing 800pc rate hike accuse mayor of spying

image.altText: A middle aged white man and woman sitting on the couch, either side of their young adult daughter. She is wearing glasses

props.synopsis: NDIS participants report sudden cuts or reviews of plans by staff who don’t understand disability, while a legal service representing participants through appeals says it has experienced a surge in demand.

title.children: 'Absolute disbelief': Families say NDIS agency doesn't understand disability

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo album promo

props.synopsis: Cynthia Erivo tells the ABC she's excited for fans to see the second Wicked film, which is due out later this year.

title.children: Cynthia Erivo on what to expect from Wicked: For Good

image.altText: Tyrese Haliburton celebrates with Aaron Nesmith

props.synopsis: Indiana completes another epic playoff comeback by stunning the 68-win Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 1 of the NBA Finals, with Tyrese Haliburton the hero for the Pacers once again.

title.children: Pacers stun Thunder in NBA Finals opener despite leading for only 0.3 seconds

image.altText: Gold bars produced by the Perth Mint and stamped with its logo.

props.synopsis: A high-ranking World Gold Council executive says Perth Mint remains "well regarded" internationally, two years after reports that the purity of its gold bars was falling short.

title.children: Golden endorsement for Perth Mint two years after 'doping' scandal

image.altText: two rugby league players doing tackle training

props.synopsis: Knights winger James Schiller allegedly received multiple messages on social media threatening physical harm during last night's NRL game against Manly.

title.children: Knights NRL player told in trolling message 'I will end your life'

image.altText: two men stand in front of a bright backdrop

props.synopsis: Hollywood co-stars and close friends Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman are new co-owners of Australia's SailGP team.

title.children: Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman buy Australian sailing team

image.altText: Hands holding a baby platypus

props.synopsis: Platypuses in Royal National Park are thought to have been wiped out by an oil spill more than 50 years ago, but the iconic animals are bouncing back thanks to a relocation program.

title.children: More platypuses released in park where species is staging a comeback

image.altText: Man sits upon the engine of a wrecked WWII era bomber plane.

props.synopsis: Eight decades after it was last in the sky, and four since it was taken from the Papua New Guinean jungle, a restored World War II bomber returns to Port Moresby from Queensland.

title.children: Crash-landed and salvaged from the jungle, WWII bomber returns home

image.altText: A photo of a white woman with blonde wavy hair cocking her head and looking thoughtful.

props.synopsis: Sara Glass' life was controlled by her husband and her rabbi. She had to fight her way out before she could embrace her sexuality.

title.children: Sara was raised to obey her husband and God. But she couldn't hide her sexuality
